notes.note:
Firefox now allows translating selected text portions to different languages after a full-page translation.

![Screenshot of the modal dialog for Selected text translation][1]


  [1]: https://www.mozilla.org/media/img/firefox/releasenotes/note-images/130_firefox_translations_modal.png

Firefox now offers an easy way to try experimental features with a new Firefox Labs page in Settings.

- [AI Chatbot feature][1] lets you add the chatbot of your choice to the sidebar, for quick access as you browse.
- Picture-in-Picture auto-open experiment enables PiP on active videos when switching tabs.

![Screenshot of the new Firefox Labs section in Settings][2]


  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/products/firefox/firefox-news/ai-services-on-firefox/
  [2]: https://mozilla.org/media/img/firefox/releasenotes/note-images/130_firefox_labs_prefs.png
Overscroll animations are now enabled as the default behavior for scrollable areas on Linux.

Starting with Firefox 130, users in the United States and Canada can view local weather directly on the new tab page. Additionally, they have the option to select a specific location to see current weather conditions.

![enter image description here][1]


  [1]: https://www.mozilla.org/media/img/firefox/releasenotes/note-images/130-weather-widget-new-york.png

The following languages are now supported by Firefox [translation][1]:

- Catalan
- Croatian
- Czech
- Danish
- Indonesian
- Latvian
- Lithuanian
- Romanian
- Serbian
- Slovak
- Vietnamese


  [1]: https://www.mozilla.org/firefox/features/translate/
WebCryptoAPI now supports Curve25519 primitives (Ed25519 signatures and X25519 key generation).

Enabled the [Web Codecs API][1] on desktop platforms, allowing low-level access to audio and video encoders and decoders.


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebCodecs_API

You can find information about policy updates and enterprise-specific bug fixes in the [Firefox for Enterprise 130 Release Notes][1].


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/firefox-enterprise-130-release-notes
Fixed an issue where `Copy` and `Paste` context menu items intermittently were not enabled when expected.

With the release of Firefox 130, we are pleased to welcome the developers who contributed their first code change to Firefox in this release, 15 of whom were brand new volunteers! system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows 10 or later

### Recommended Hardware
-  1 gigahertz (GHz) or faster compatible processor or System on a Chip (SoC)
-  1GB of RAM / 2GB of RAM for the 64-bit version
-  500MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- macOS 10.15 or later

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 or Apple silicon processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - glibc 2.17 or higher
    - GTK+ 3.14 or higher
    - libglib 2.42 or higher
    - libstdc++ 4.8.1 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - PulseAudio
